intro: Rhagodia billardierei var. linearis, commonly known as the slender rhagodia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. It is a perennial herb that produces red or pink flowers, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
